did.abstract: The Lewis Katz Papers contain administrative documentation of his work as a Professor of Chemistry (1952-1988) and Vice President of Academic Affairs (circa 1981-1988) at the University of Connecticut.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Lewis Katz was appointed as Instructor in the Chemistry Department at the University of Connecticut in 1952. He was appointed Associate Vice President of Academic Affairs in circa 1981, a position he held until his retirement in 1988.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open and available for research.

acqinfo.head: Provenance and Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Unknown; presumably transferred by the Provosts Office after Dr. Katz's retirement.
